repnme.cdata!: Mali - Public Works and Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Public Works and Capacity Building
            Project in the Republic of Mali. The main objectives of the
            project were: (i) to create temporary employment by means of
            labor-intensive technologies; (ii) to increase the
            productivity of Bamako and its vicinity by means of a
            program of urgently needed small-scale public works; (iii)
            to increase the capacity of the public sector to orient and
            manage efficiently its demandfor, and expenditures on, goods
            and services and to demonstrate the feasibility of more
            transparent procurement procedures; (iv) to improve public
            procu4re ment by strengthening the Direction Generale des
            Marches Publics (DGMP); and (v) to strengthen the capacity
            of the private sector, small and medium-sized contractors
            and consulting firms, to design and execute a wide range of
            public works. Bank's performance was highly
            satisfactory. Borrower's performance was highly
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            success through an autonomous and transparent institutional
            model; (ii) developing capacity for operations and
            maintenance (O&M) to ensure sustainability of
            sub-projects; (iii) the need for decentralization and
            replication; (iv) payments without delay to ensure
            development of local contractors; and (v) technical
            assistance to improve the quality of works.

repnme.cdata!:
Mali - Supplemental credit to the Public
            Works and Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Works and Capacity Building
            Project consists of one major "hardware" component
            which, in terms of cost, represents the bulk of the project,
            and several "software" components including: (a) a
            program of essential, small-scale public works aimed at
            rehabilitating and maintaining urban infrastructure; (b) a
            package of technical and managerial assistance to be offered
            to contractors; (c) a training program to improve the
            capacity of local governments to identify subprojects, and
            the capacity of consulting firms to prepare feasibility
            studies and technical project proposals; (d) a program aimed
            at increasing grassroots participation in subproject
            identification and maintenance; (e) consulting services
            aimed at closely monitoring progress under the project; and
            (f) a procurement reform implementation component to train
            staff in the Direction General des Marches Publics (DGMP)
            and in the main technical ministries, to finance the
            equipment the DGMP will need to carry out its activities,
            and to provide consulting services for drafting standard
            bidding and contract documentation.
